column4: Hello, is anyone here able to offer me some guidance on general Ruby development questions I have?
depends on what you are trying to achieve
python has nice win32 extensions and a very good windows port
You can knock WYSIWYG IDE's all you wan't the fact is that they build apps quicker.
yes, but programming by point'n'click? that's news for me :)
not that I don't like building GUIs in a graphical way, but the programming itself still has to be done by hand, doesn't it?
True, it's nice to have a basic, set template to work with though.
python IMHO has more and better 3rd party libraries and bindings
you can have that, too. I built GTK2 apps using glade, a GUI designer and then used tepache to create skeleton python code from the XML description of teh GUI
You make me feel like a n00b.
it's not that hard... wait a sec
